SecurityGroupIds.description: The security group IDs of the infrastructure configuration.

SnsTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic for the infrastructure configuration.

SubnetId.description: The subnet ID of the infrastructure configuration.

Tags.description: The tags of the infrastructure configuration.

TerminateInstanceOnFailure.description: The terminate instance on failure configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

AssessmentTargetName.description: The name of the Amazon Inspector assessment target. The name must be unique within the AWS account.

ResourceGroupArn.description: The ARN that specifies the resource group that is used to create the assessment target. If resourceGroupArn is not specified, all EC2 instances in the current AWS account and Region are included in the assessment target.

AssessmentTargetArn.description: The ARN of the assessment target to be included in the assessment template.

AssessmentTemplateName.description: The user-defined name that identifies the assessment template that you want to create. You can create several assessment templates for the same assessment target. The names of the assessment templates that correspond to a particular assessment target must be unique.

DurationInSeconds.description: The duration of the assessment run in seconds.

RulesPackageArns.description: The ARNs of the rules packages that you want to use in the assessment template.

UserAttributesForFindings.description: The user-defined attributes that are assigned to every finding that is generated by the assessment run that uses this assessment template. Within an assessment template, each key must be unique.

ResourceGroupTags.description: The tags (key and value pairs) that will be associated with the resource group.

Description.description: A description of the filter.

FilterAction.description: The action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

FilterCriteria.description: Details on the filter criteria associated with this filter.

Name.description: The name of the filter.

DeviceId.description: The ID of the device, such as G030PX0312744DWM.

Enabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the device is enabled (true) or not (false).

AssociatedDevices.description: The devices to associate with the placement, as defined by a mapping of zero or more key-value pairs wherein the key is a template name and the value is a device ID.

Attributes.description: The user-defined attributes associated with the placement.

ProjectName.description: The name of the project containing the placement.

Description.description: The description of the project.

PlacementTemplate.description: An object describing the project's placement specifications.

ProjectName.description: The name of the project from which to obtain information.

AccountId.description: The ID of the account. You can use the expression !Sub "${AWS::AccountId}" to use your account ID.

AuditCheckConfigurations.description: Specifies which audit checks are enabled and disabled for this account.

AuditNotificationTargetConfigurations.description: Information about the targets to which audit notifications are sent.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT to access information about your devices, policies, certificates, and other items as required when performing an audit.

EnableCachingForHttp.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

SigningDisabled.description: Specifies whether AWS IoT validates the token signature in an authorization request.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the custom authorizer.

TokenKeyName.description: The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.

TokenSigningPublicKeys.description: The public keys used to validate the token signature returned by your custom authentication service.

AutoRegistrationStatus.description: Whether the CA certificate is configured for auto registration of device certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE".

CACertificatePem.description: The certificate data in PEM format.

Status.description: The status of the CA certificate.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

CACertificatePem.description: The CA certificate used to sign the device certificate being registered, not available when CertificateMode is SNI_ONLY.

CertificateMode.description: Specifies which mode of certificate registration to use with this resource. Valid options are DEFAULT with CaCertificatePem and CertificatePem, SNI_ONLY with CertificatePem, and Default with CertificateSigningRequest.

CertificatePem.description: The certificate data in PEM format. Requires SNI_ONLY for the certificate mode or the accompanying CACertificatePem for registration.

DisplayName.description: The friendly name in the console for the custom metric. This name doesn't have to be unique. Don't use this name as the metric identifier in the device metric report. You can update the friendly name after you define it.

MetricName.description: The name of the custom metric. This will be used in the metric report submitted from the device/thing. The name can't begin with aws:. You canâ€™t change the name after you define it.

MetricType.description: The type of the custom metric. Types include string-list, ip-address-list, number-list, and number.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the custom metric.

Name.description: A unique identifier for the dimension.

StringValues.description: Specifies the value or list of values for the dimension. For TOPIC_FILTER dimensions, this is a pattern used to match the MQTT topic (for example, "admin/#").

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the dimension.

Type.description: Specifies the type of dimension. Supported types: TOPIC_FILTER.

AuthorizerConfig.description: An object that specifies the authorization service for a domain.

DomainConfigurationName.description: The name of the domain configuration. This value must be unique to a region.

DomainConfigurationStatus.description: The status to which the domain configuration should be updated.

DomainName.description: The name of the domain.

ServerCertificateArns.description: The ARNs of the certificates that AWS IoT passes to the device during the TLS handshake. Currently you can specify only one certificate ARN. This value is not required for AWS-managed domains.

ServiceType.description: The type of service delivered by the endpoint.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the domain configuration.

ValidationCertificateArn.description: The certificate used to validate the server certificate and prove domain name ownership. This certificate must be signed by a public certificate authority. This value is not required for AWS-managed domains.

AggregationType.description: The type of the aggregation query.

Description.description: The fleet metric description.

IndexName.description: The name of the index to search.

MetricName.description: The name of the fleet metric to create.

Period.description: The time in seconds between fleet metric emissions. Range [60(1 min), 86400(1 day)] and must be multiple of 60.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the fleet metric.

Unit.description: Used to support unit transformation such as milliseconds to seconds. Must be a unit supported by CW metric. Default to null.

AbortConfig.description: The criteria that determine when and how a job abort takes place.

Description.description: A description of the job template.

DocumentSource.description: An S3 link to the job document to use in the template. Required if you don't specify a value for document.

JobArn.description: The ARN of the job to use as the basis for the job template.

JobExecutionsRetryConfig.description: Allows you to create the criteria to retry a job.

JobExecutionsRolloutConfig.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

JobTemplateId.description: A unique identifier for the job template. We recommend using a UUID. Alpha-numeric characters, "-", and "_" are valid for use here.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the job template.

TimeoutConfig.description: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

DefaultLogLevel.description: The default log level. Valid Values: DEBUG | INFO | ERROR | WARN | DISABLED

RoleArn.description: The role ARN used for the log.

ActionName.description: The friendly name of the mitigation action.

ActionParams.description: The set of parameters for this mitigation action. The parameters vary, depending on the kind of action you apply.

RoleArn.description: The IAM role ARN used to apply this mitigation action.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the mitigation action.

PolicyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

PolicyName.description: The name of the AWS IoT policy.

Principal.description: The principal, which can be a certificate ARN (as returned from the CreateCertificate operation) or an Amazon Cognito ID.

Description.description: The description of the fleet provisioning template.

Enabled.description: True to enable the fleet provisioning template, otherwise false.

ProvisioningRoleArn.description: The role ARN for the role associated with the fleet provisioning template. This IoT role grants permission to provision a device.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the fleet provisioning template.

TemplateBody.description: The JSON formatted contents of the fleet provisioning template version.

TemplateName.description: The name of the fleet provisioning template.

TemplateType.description: The type of the provisioning template.

LogLevel.description: The default log level.Valid Values: DEBUG | INFO | ERROR | WARN | DISABLED

TargetType.description: The target type. Valid Values: DEFAULT | THING_GROUP

CredentialDurationSeconds.description: The number of seconds for which the credential is valid.

RoleArn.description: The role ARN.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

DayOfMonth.description: The day of the month on which the scheduled audit is run (if the frequency is "MONTHLY"). If days 29-31 are specified, and the month does not have that many days, the audit takes place on the "LAST" day of the month.

DayOfWeek.description: The day of the week on which the scheduled audit is run (if the frequency is "WEEKLY" or "BIWEEKLY").

Frequency.description: How often the scheduled audit occurs.

ScheduledAuditName.description: The name of the scheduled audit.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the scheduled audit.

TargetCheckNames.description: Which checks are performed during the scheduled audit. Checks must be enabled for your account. (Use DescribeAccountAuditConfiguration to see the list of all checks, including those that are enabled or use UpdateAccountAuditConfiguration to select which checks are enabled.)

AdditionalMetricsToRetainV2.description: A list of metrics whose data is retained (stored). By default, data is retained for any metric used in the profile's behaviors, but it's also retained for any metric specified here. Can be used with custom metrics; can't be used with dimensions.

AlertTargets.description: Specifies the destinations to which alerts are sent. (Alerts are always sent to the console.) Alerts are generated when a device (thing) violates a behavior.

Behaviors.description: Specifies the behaviors that, when violated by a device (thing), cause an alert.

SecurityProfileDescription.description: A description of the security profile.

SecurityProfileName.description: The name you gave to the security profile.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the security profile.

TargetArns.description: The ARN of the target (thing group) to which the security profile is attached.

AttributePayload.description: A string that contains up to three key value pairs. Maximum length of 800. Duplicates not allowed.

ThingName.description: The name of the thing to update.

Principal.description: The principal, which can be a certificate ARN (as returned from the CreateCertificate operation) or an Amazon Cognito ID.

ThingName.description: The name of the AWS IoT thing.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the topic rule.

Status.description: A topic rule destination was created but has not been confirmed. You can set status to IN_PROGRESS by calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination. Calling UpdateTopicRuleDestination causes a new confirmation challenge to be sent to your confirmation endpoint.

VpcProperties.description: Properties of the virtual private cloud (VPC) connection.

RetentionPeriod.description: How long, in days, message data is kept for the channel.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the channel.

Actions.description: The DatasetAction objects that automatically create the dataset contents.

ContentDeliveryRules.description: When dataset contents are created they are delivered to destinations specified here.

LateDataRules.description: A list of data rules that send notifications to CloudWatch, when data arrives late. To specify lateDataRules, the dataset must use a DeltaTimer filter.

RetentionPeriod.description: Optional. How long, in days, message data is kept for the dataset.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the data set.

Triggers.description: The DatasetTrigger objects that specify when the dataset is automatically updated.

VersioningConfiguration.description: Optional. How many versions of dataset contents are kept. If not specified or set to null, only the latest version plus the latest succeeded version (if they are different) are kept for the time period specified by the retentionPeriod parameter. For more information, see Keeping Multiple Versions of AWS IoT Analytics datasets in the  AWS IoT Analytics User Guide.

DatastoreName.description: The name of the data store.

DatastorePartitions.description: Information about the partition dimensions in a data store.

DatastoreStorage.description: Where data store data is stored.

FileFormatConfiguration.description: Contains the configuration information of file formats.  AWS IoT Analytics data stores support JSON and Parquet.

RetentionPeriod.description: How long, in days, message data is kept for the data store. When customerManagedS3 storage is selected, this parameter is ignored.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the data store.

PipelineActivities.description: A list of "PipelineActivity" objects. Activities perform transformations on your messages, such as removing, renaming or adding message attributes; filtering messages based on attribute values; invoking your Lambda functions on messages for advanced processing; or performing mathematical transformations to normalize device data.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the pipeline.

SuiteDefinitionConfiguration.description: The configuration of the Suite Definition. Listed below are the required elements of the SuiteDefinitionConfiguration.

Tags.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the the Suite Definition.

AlarmCapabilities.description: Contains the configuration information of alarm state changes.

AlarmEventActions.description: Contains information about one or more alarm actions.

AlarmModelDescription.description: The description of the alarm model.

AlarmModelName.description: The name of the alarm model.

AlarmRule.description: Defines when your alarm is invoked.

Key.description: An input attribute used as a key to create an alarm. AWS IoT Events routes inputs associated with this key to the alarm.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that allows the alarm to perform actions and access AWS resources. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

Severity.description: A non-negative integer that reflects the severity level of the alarm.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the alarm model. The tags help you manage the alarm model. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT Events resources in the AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.

DetectorModelDefinition.description: Information that defines how a detector operates.

DetectorModelDescription.description: A brief description of the detector model.

DetectorModelName.description: The name of the detector model.

EvaluationMethod.description: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.

Key.description: The value used to identify a detector instance. When a device or system sends input, a new detector instance with a unique key value is created. AWS IoT Events can continue to route input to its corresponding detector instance based on this identifying information.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

InputDescription.description: A brief description of the input.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

ApplicationDescription.description: An optional description of the web application.

ApplicationName.description: The name of the web application.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that the web application assumes when it interacts with AWS IoT Core.

Tags.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can use to manage the web application resource.

Action.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

CollectionScheme.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Compression.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

DataExtraDimensions.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

ExpiryTime.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Priority.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

SpoolingMode.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

StartTime.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Tags.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

TargetArn.description: The ARN of a vehicle or fleet to which the campaign is deployed.

ModelManifestArn.description: The ARN of a vehicle model (model manifest) associated with the decoder manifest.

Name.description: The name of the decoder manifest.

NetworkInterfaces.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

SignalDecoders.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Status.description: The state of the decoder manifest. If the status is ACTIVE, the decoder manifest can't be edited. If the status is marked DRAFT, you can edit the decoder manifest.

Tags.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Description.description: A brief description of the fleet.

Id.description: The unique ID of the fleet.

SignalCatalogArn.description: The ARN of the signal catalog associated with the fleet.

Tags.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Description.description: A brief description of the vehicle model.

Name.description: The name of the vehicle model.

Nodes.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

SignalCatalogArn.description: The ARN of the signal catalog associated with the vehicle model.

Status.description: The state of the vehicle model. If the status is ACTIVE, the vehicle model can't be edited. If the status is DRAFT, you can edit the vehicle model.

Tags.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Description.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Name.description: The name of the signal catalog.

Nodes.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Tags.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

AssociationBehavior.description: An option to create a new AWS IoT thing when creating a vehicle, or to validate an existing thing as a vehicle.

Attributes.description: Static information about a vehicle in a key-value pair. For example: "engine Type" : "v6"

DecoderManifestArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a decoder manifest associated with the vehicle to create.

ModelManifestArn.description: The ARN of the vehicle model (model manifest) to create the vehicle from.

Name.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

Tags.description: Metadata which can be used to manage the vehicle.

AccessPolicyIdentity.description: The identity for this access policy. Choose an IAM Identity Center user, an IAM Identity Center group, or an IAM user.

AccessPolicyPermission.description: The permission level for this access policy. Choose either a ADMINISTRATOR or VIEWER. Note that a project ADMINISTRATOR is also known as a project owner.

AccessPolicyResource.description: The AWS IoT SiteWise Monitor resource for this access policy. Choose either a portal or a project.

AssetHierarchies.description: A list of asset hierarchies that each contain a hierarchyLogicalId. A hierarchy specifies allowed parent/child asset relationships.

AssetModelId.description: The ID of the asset model from which to create the asset.

AssetName.description: A unique, friendly name for the asset.

AssetProperties.description: The list of asset properties for the asset.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the asset. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

AssetModelCompositeModels.description: The composite asset models that are part of this asset model. Composite asset models are asset models that contain specific properties. Each composite model has a type that defines the properties that the composite model supports. You can use composite asset models to define alarms on this asset model.

AssetModelDescription.description: A description for the asset model.

AssetModelHierarchies.description: The hierarchy definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy specifies an asset model whose assets can be children of any other assets created from this asset model. For more information, see Defining relationships between assets in the AWS IoT SiteWiseUser Guide.

AssetModelName.description: A unique, friendly name for the asset model.

AssetModelProperties.description: The property definitions of the asset model. For more information, see Defining data properties in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the asset. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

DashboardDefinition.description: The dashboard definition specified in a JSON literal. For detailed information, see Creating dashboards (CLI) in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

DashboardName.description: A friendly name for the dashboard.

ProjectId.description: The ID of the project in which to create the dashboard.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the dashboard. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

GatewayCapabilitySummaries.description: A list of gateway capability summaries that each contain a namespace and status. Each gateway capability defines data sources for the gateway. To retrieve a capability configuration's definition, use DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.

GatewayName.description: A unique, friendly name for the gateway.

GatewayPlatform.description: The gateway's platform. You can only specify one platform in a gateway.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the gateway. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

Alarms.description: Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an AWS IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a specified range. For more information, see Monitoring with alarms in the AWS IoT SiteWise Application Guide.

NotificationSenderEmail.description: The email address that sends alarm notifications.

PortalAuthMode.description: The service to use to authenticate users to the portal. Choose from the following options:

PortalContactEmail.description: The AWS administrator's contact email address.

PortalName.description: A friendly name for the portal.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of a service role that allows the portal's users to access your AWS IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more information, see Using service roles for AWS IoT SiteWise Monitor in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the portal. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

AssetIds.description: A list that contains the IDs of each asset associated with the project.

PortalId.description: The ID of the portal in which to create the project.

ProjectName.description: A friendly name for the project.

Tags.description: A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the project. For more information, see Tagging your AWS IoT SiteWise resources in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.

ComponentTypeId.description: The ID of the component type.

ExtendsFrom.description: The name of the parent component type that this component type extends.

IsSingleton.description: A boolean value that specifies whether an entity can have more than one component of this type.

PropertyDefinitions.description: An object that maps strings to the property definitions in the component type. Each string in the mapping must be unique to this object.

Components.description: An object that maps strings to the components in the entity. Each string in the mapping must be unique to this object.

Description.description: The description of the entity.

ParentEntityId.description: The ID of the parent entity.

Tags.description: Metadata that you can use to manage the entity.

Capabilities.description: A list of capabilities that the scene uses to render.

ContentLocation.description: The relative path that specifies the location of the content definition file.

Description.description: The description of this scene.

Tags.description: The ComponentType tags.

Role.description: The ARN of the execution role associated with the workspace.

S3Location.description: The ARN of the S3 bucket where resources associated with the workspace are stored.

Tags.description: Metadata that you can use to manage the workspace.

Description.description: The description of the new resource. Maximum length is 2048 characters.

Expression.description: The rule name to send messages to.

ExpressionType.description: The type of value in Expression.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM Role that authorizes the destination.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

AssociateMulticastGroup.description: The ID of the multicast group to associate with a FUOTA task.

AssociateWirelessDevice.description: The ID of the wireless device to associate with a multicast group.

Description.description: The description of the new resource.

DisassociateMulticastGroup.description: The ID of the multicast group to disassociate from a FUOTA task.

DisassociateWirelessDevice.description: The ID of the wireless device to disassociate from a FUOTA task.

FirmwareUpdateImage.description: The S3 URI points to a firmware update image that is to be used with a FUOTA task.

FirmwareUpdateRole.description: The firmware update role that is to be used with a FUOTA task.

LoRaWAN.description: The LoRaWAN information used with a FUOTA task.

Name.description: The name of a FUOTA task.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

AssociateWirelessDevice.description: The ID of the wireless device to associate with a multicast group.

Description.description: The description of the multicast group.

DisassociateWirelessDevice.description: The ID of the wireless device to disassociate from a multicast group.

LoRaWAN.description: The LoRaWAN information that is to be used with the multicast group.

Name.description: The name of the multicast group.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

Description.description: The description of the resource.

Name.description: Name of the network analyzer configuration.

Tags.description: The tags to attach to the specified resource. Tags are metadata that you can use to manage a resource.

TraceContent.description: Trace content for your wireless gateway and wireless device resources.

WirelessDevices.description: Wireless device resources to add to the network analyzer configuration. Provide the WirelessDeviceId of the resource to add in the input array.

WirelessGateways.description: Wireless gateway resources to add to the network analyzer configuration. Provide the WirelessGatewayId of the resource to add in the input array.

PartnerAccountId.description: The ID of the partner account to update.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

AutoCreateTasks.description: Whether to automatically create tasks using this task definition for all gateways with the specified current version. If false, the task must me created by calling CreateWirelessGatewayTask.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

Update.description: Information about the gateways to update.

Description.description: The description of the new resource. Maximum length is 2048.

DestinationName.description: The name of the destination to assign to the new wireless device. Can have only have alphanumeric, - (hyphen) and _ (underscore) characters and it can't have any spaces.

LastUplinkReceivedAt.description: The date and time when the most recent uplink was received.

LoRaWAN.description: The device configuration information to use to create the wireless device. Must be at least one of OtaaV10x, OtaaV11, AbpV11, or AbpV10x.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

ThingArn.description: The ARN of the thing to associate with the wireless device.

Type.description: The wireless device type.

Description.description: The description of the new resource. The maximum length is 2048 characters.

LastUplinkReceivedAt.description: The date and time when the most recent uplink was received.

LoRaWAN.description: The gateway configuration information to use to create the wireless gateway.

Name.description: The name of the new resource.

Tags.description: The tags are an array of key-value pairs to attach to the specified resource. Tags can have a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 50 items.

ThingArn.description: The ARN of the thing to associate with the wireless gateway.

ThingName.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

AliasName.description: Specifies the alias name. This value must begin with alias/ followed by a name, such as alias/ExampleAlias.

TargetKeyId.description: Associates the alias with the specified customer managed key. The KMS key must be in the same AWS account and Region.

Description.description: A description of the KMS key. Use a description that helps you to distinguish this KMS key from others in the account, such as its intended use.

EnableKeyRotation.description: Enables automatic rotation of the key material for the specified KMS key. By default, automatic key rotation is not enabled.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether the KMS key is enabled. Disabled KMS keys cannot be used in cryptographic operations.

KeyPolicy.description: The key policy that authorizes use of the KMS key. The key policy must conform to the following rules.

KeySpec.description: Specifies the type of KMS key to create. The default value, SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT, creates a KMS key with a 256-bit symmetric key for encryption and decryption. In China Regions, SYMMETRIC_DEFAULT creates a 128-bit symmetric key that uses SM4 encryption. You can't change the KeySpec value after the KMS key is created. For help choosing a key spec for your KMS key, see Choosing a KMS key type in the AWS Key Management Service Developer Guide.

KeyUsage.description: Determines the cryptographic operations for which you can use the KMS key. The default value is ENCRYPT_DECRYPT. This property is required for asymmetric KMS keys and HMAC KMS keys. You can't change the KeyUsage value after the KMS key is created.

MultiRegion.description: Creates a multi-Region primary key that you can replicate in other AWS Regions. You can't change the MultiRegion value after the KMS key is created.

PendingWindowInDays.description: Specifies the number of days in the waiting period before AWS KMS deletes a KMS key that has been removed from a CloudFormation stack. Enter a value between 7 and 30 days. The default value is 30 days.

Tags.description: Assigns one or more tags to the replica key.

Description.description: A description of the KMS key.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether the replica key is enabled. Disabled KMS keys cannot be used in cryptographic operations.

KeyPolicy.description: The key policy that authorizes use of the replica key.

PendingWindowInDays.description: Specifies the number of days in the waiting period before AWS KMS deletes a replica key that has been removed from a CloudFormation stack. Enter a value between 7 and 30 days. The default value is 30 days.

PrimaryKeyArn.description: Specifies the multi-Region primary key to replicate. The primary key must be in a different AWS Region of the same AWS partition. You can create only one replica of a given primary key in each AWS Region .

Tags.description: Assigns one or more tags to the replica key.

KafkaCluster.description: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

KafkaClusterClientAuthentication.description: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.

KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit.description: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

KafkaConnectVersion.description: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.

LogDelivery.description: The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

Plugins.description: Specifies which plugin to use for the connector. You must specify a single-element list. Amazon MSK Connect does not currently support specifying multiple plugins.

ServiceExecutionRoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web Services resources.

WorkerConfiguration.description: The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.

CustomDocumentEnrichmentConfiguration.description: Configuration information for altering document metadata and content during the document ingestion process.

DataSourceConfiguration.description: Configuration information for an Amazon Kendra data source. The contents of the configuration depend on the type of data source. You can only specify one type of data source in the configuration. Choose from one of the following data sources.

Description.description: A description of the data source.

IndexId.description: The identifier of the index that should be associated with this data source.

Name.description: The name of the data source.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to access the data source.

Schedule.description: Sets the frequency that Amazon Kendra checks the documents in your data source and updates the index. If you don't set a schedule, Amazon Kendra doesn't periodically update the index.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource

Type.description: The type of the data source.

Description.description: A description of the FAQ.

FileFormat.description: The format of the input file. You can choose between a basic CSV format, a CSV format that includes customs attributes in a header, and a JSON format that includes custom attributes.

IndexId.description: The identifier of the index that contains the FAQ.

Name.description: The name that you assigned the FAQ when you created or updated the FAQ.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to access the S3 bucket that contains the FAQ.

S3Path.description: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) location of the FAQ input data.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource

CapacityUnits.description: Specifies capacity units configured for your index. You can add and remove capacity units to tune an index to your requirements. You can set capacity units only for Enterprise edition indexes.

Description.description: A description of the index.

DocumentMetadataConfigurations.description: Specifies the properties of an index field. You can add either a custom or a built-in field. You can add and remove built-in fields at any time. When a built-in field is removed it's configuration reverts to the default for the field. Custom fields can't be removed from an index after they are added.

Edition.description: Indicates whether the index is a enterprise edition index or a developer edition index. Valid values are DEVELOPER_EDITION and ENTERPRISE_EDITION.

Name.description: The name of the index.

RoleArn.description: An IAM role that gives Amazon Kendra permissions to access your Amazon CloudWatch logs and metrics. This is also the role used when you use the BatchPutDocument operation to index documents from an Amazon S3 bucket.

ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration.description: The identifier of the AWS KMS customer managed key (CMK) to use to encrypt data indexed by Amazon Kendra. Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric CMKs.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

UserTokenConfigurations.description: Defines the type of user token used for the index.

Name.description: The name of the Kinesis stream. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the stream name. For more information, see Name Type.

RetentionPeriodHours.description: The number of hours for the data records that are stored in shards to remain accessible. The default value is 24. For more information about the stream retention period, see Changing the Data Retention Period in the Amazon Kinesis Developer Guide.

ShardCount.description: The number of shards that the stream uses. For greater provisioned throughput, increase the number of shards.

StreamEncryption.description: When specified, enables or updates server-side encryption using an AWS KMS key for a specified stream. Removing this property from your stack template and updating your stack disables encryption.

StreamModeDetails.description: Specifies the capacity mode to which you want to set your data stream. Currently, in Kinesis Data Streams, you can choose between an on-demand capacity mode and a provisioned capacity mode for your data streams.

Tags.description: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) to associate with the Kinesis stream. For information about constraints for this property, see Tag Restrictions in the Amazon Kinesis Developer Guide.

ConsumerName.description: The name of the consumer is something you choose when you register the consumer.

StreamARN.description: The ARN of the stream with which you registered the consumer.

ApplicationCode.description: One or more SQL statements that read input data, transform it, and generate output. For example, you can write a SQL statement that reads data from one in-application stream, generates a running average of the number of advertisement clicks by vendor, and insert resulting rows in another in-application stream using pumps. For more information about the typical pattern, see Application Code.

ApplicationName.description: Name of your Amazon Kinesis Analytics application (for example, sample-app).

Inputs.description: Use this parameter to configure the application input.

ApplicationName.description: Name of the application to which you want to add the output configuration.

Output.description: An array of objects, each describing one output configuration. In the output configuration, you specify the name of an in-application stream, a destination (that is, an Amazon Kinesis stream, an Amazon Kinesis Firehose delivery stream, or an AWS Lambda function), and record the formation to use when writing to the destination.

ReferenceDataSource.description: The reference data source can be an object in your Amazon S3 bucket. Amazon Kinesis Analytics reads the object and copies the data into the in-application table that is created. You provide an S3 bucket, object key name, and the resulting in-application table that is created. You must also provide an IAM role with the necessary permissions that Amazon Kinesis Analytics can assume to read the object from your S3 bucket on your behalf.

ApplicationConfiguration.description: Use this parameter to configure the application.

ApplicationMaintenanceConfiguration.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

ApplicationMode.description: To create a Kinesis Data Analytics Studio notebook, you must set the mode to INTERACTIVE. However, for a Kinesis Data Analytics for Apache Flink application, the mode is optional.

RunConfiguration.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

RuntimeEnvironment.description: The runtime environment for the application.

ServiceExecutionRole.description: Specifies the IAM role that the application uses to access external resources.

Tags.description: A list of one or more tags to assign to the application. A tag is a key-value pair that identifies an application. Note that the maximum number of application tags includes system tags. The maximum number of user-defined application tags is 50.

CloudWatchLoggingOption.description: Provides a description of Amazon CloudWatch logging options, including the log stream Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

Output.description: Describes a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application's output configuration, in which you identify an in-application stream and a destination where you want the in-application stream data to be written. The destination can be a Kinesis data stream or a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

ReferenceDataSource.description: For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, describes the reference data source by providing the source information (Amazon S3 bucket name and object key name), the resulting in-application table name that is created, and the necessary schema to map the data elements in the Amazon S3 object to the in-application table.

AmazonopensearchserviceDestinationConfig.description: The destination in Amazon OpenSearch Service. You can specify only one destination.

DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfigurationInp.description: Specifies the type and Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK to use for Server-Side Encryption (SSE).

DeliveryStreamName.description: The name of the delivery stream.

DeliveryStreamType.description: The delivery stream type. This can be one of the following values:

ElasticsearchDestinationConfiguration.description: An Amazon ES destination for the delivery stream.

ExtendedS3DestinationConfiguration.description: An Amazon S3 destination for the delivery stream.

HttpEndpointDestinationConfiguration.description: Enables configuring Kinesis Firehose to deliver data to any HTTP endpoint destination. You can specify only one destination.

KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration.description: When a Kinesis stream is used as the source for the delivery stream, a KinesisStreamSourceConfiguration containing the Kinesis stream ARN and the role ARN for the source stream.

RedshiftDestinationConfiguration.description: An Amazon Redshift destination for the delivery stream.

S3DestinationConfiguration.description: The S3DestinationConfiguration property type specifies an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) destination to which Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose (Kinesis Data Firehose) delivers data.

SplunkDestinationConfiguration.description: The configuration of a destination in Splunk for the delivery stream.

Tags.description: A set of tags to assign to the delivery stream. A tag is a key-value pair that you can define and assign to AWS resources. Tags are metadata. For example, you can add friendly names and descriptions or other types of information that can help you distinguish the delivery stream. For more information about tags, see Using Cost Allocation Tags in the AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide.

MessageTtlSeconds.description: The period of time a signaling channel retains undelivered messages before they are discarded.

Name.description: A name for the signaling channel that you are creating. It must be unique for each AWS account and AWS Region.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

Type.description: A type of the signaling channel that you are creating. Currently, SINGLE_MASTER is the only supported channel type.

DataRetentionInHours.description: How long the stream retains data, in hours.

DeviceName.description: The name of the device that is associated with the stream.

KmsKeyId.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Kinesis Video Streams uses to encrypt data on the stream.

Name.description: The name of the stream.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

ColumnNames.description: An array of UTF-8 strings. A list of column names.

ColumnWildcard.description: A wildcard with exclusions. You must specify either a ColumnNames list or the ColumnWildCard.

DatabaseName.description: UTF-8 string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

Name.description: UTF-8 string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

TableCatalogId.description: Catalog id string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

TableName.description: UTF-8 string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

Admins.description: A list of AWS Lake Formation principals.

PermissionsWithGrantOption.description: Indicates the ability to grant permissions (as a subset of permissions granted).

Catalog.description: The identifier for the Data Catalog. By default, the account ID. The Data Catalog is the persistent metadata store. It contains database definitions, table definitions, and other control information to manage your Lake Formation environment.

PermissionsWithGrantOption.description: Indicates the ability to grant permissions (as a subset of permissions granted).

Principal.description: The principal to be granted a permission.

Resource.description: The resource to be granted or revoked permissions.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

RoleArn.description: The IAM role that registered a resource.

UseServiceLinkedRole.description: Designates a trusted caller, an IAM principal, by registering this caller with the Data Catalog.

CatalogId.description: Catalog id string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

TagKey.description: UTF-8 string, not less than 1 or more than 255 bytes long, matching the single-line string pattern.

TagValues.description: An array of UTF-8 strings, not less than 1 or more than 50 strings.

LFTags.description: A structure containing an LF-tag key-value pair.

Description.description: A description of the alias.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function.

FunctionVersion.description: The function version that the alias invokes.

Name.description: The name of the alias.

ProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: Specifies a provisioned concurrency configuration for a function's alias.

RoutingConfig.description: The routing configuration of the alias.

CodeSigningPolicies.description: The code signing policy controls the validation failure action for signature mismatch or expiry.

Description.description: Code signing configuration description.

DestinationConfig.description: A destination for events after they have been sent to a function for processing.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function.

MaximumEventAgeInSeconds.description: The maximum age of a request that Lambda sends to a function for processing.

MaximumRetryAttempts.description: The maximum number of times to retry when the function returns an error.

Qualifier.description: The identifier of a version or alias.

AmazonManagedKafkaEventSourceConfig.description: Specific configuration settings for an Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) event source.

BatchSize.description: The maximum number of records in each batch that Lambda pulls from your stream or queue and sends to your function. Lambda passes all of the records in the batch to the function in a single call, up to the payload limit for synchronous invocation (6 MB).

BisectBatchOnFunctionError.description: (Streams only) If the function returns an error, split the batch in two and retry. The default value is false.

DestinationConfig.description: (Streams only) An Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic destination for discarded records.

Enabled.description: When true, the event source mapping is active. When false, Lambda pauses polling and invocation.

EventSourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event source.

FilterCriteria.description: An object that defines the filter criteria that determine whether Lambda should process an event. For more information, see Lambda event filtering.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function.

FunctionResponseTypes.description: (Streams and SQS) A list of current response type enums applied to the event source mapping.

MaximumBatchingWindowInSeconds.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that Lambda spends gathering records before invoking the function.

MaximumRecordAgeInSeconds.description: (Streams only) Discard records older than the specified age. The default value is -1, which sets the maximum age to infinite. When the value is set to infinite, Lambda never discards old records.

MaximumRetryAttempts.description: (Streams only) Discard records after the specified number of retries. The default value is -1, which sets the maximum number of retries to infinite. When MaximumRetryAttempts is infinite, Lambda retries failed records until the record expires in the event source.

ParallelizationFactor.description: (Streams only) The number of batches to process concurrently from each shard. The default value is 1.

Queues.description: (Amazon MQ) The name of the Amazon MQ broker destination queue to consume.

SelfManagedEventSource.description: The self-managed Apache Kafka cluster for your event source.

SelfManagedKafkaEventSourceConfig.description: Specific configuration settings for a self-managed Apache Kafka event source.

SourceAccessConfigurations.description: An array of the authentication protocol, VPC components, or virtual host to secure and define your event source.

StartingPosition.description: The position in a stream from which to start reading. Required for Amazon Kinesis and Amazon DynamoDB.

StartingPositionTimestamp.description: With StartingPosition set to AT_TIMESTAMP, the time from which to start reading, in Unix time seconds.

Topics.description: The name of the Kafka topic.

TumblingWindowInSeconds.description: (Streams only) The duration in seconds of a processing window. The range is between 1 second and 900 seconds.

Architectures.description: The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Enter a string array with one of the valid values (arm64 or x86_64). The default value is x86_64.

CodeSigningConfigArn.description: To enable code signing for this function, specify the ARN of a code-signing configuration. A code-signing configuration includes a set of signing profiles, which define the trusted publishers for this function.

DeadLetterConfig.description: A dead letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing. For more information, see Dead Letter Queues.

Description.description: A description of the function.

Environment.description: Environment variables that are accessible from function code during execution.

EphemeralStorage.description: The size of the functionâ€™s /tmp directory in MB. The default value is 512, but can be any whole number between 512 and 10240 MB.

FileSystemConfigs.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. To connect a function to a file system, a mount target must be available in every Availability Zone that your function connects to. If your template contains an AWS::EFS::MountTarget resource, you must also specify a DependsOn attribute to ensure that the mount target is created or updated before the function.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function, up to 64 characters in length. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates one.

Handler.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function. Handler is required if the deployment package is a .zip file archive. The format includes the file name. It can also include namespaces and other qualifiers, depending on the runtime. For more information, see Programming Model.

ImageConfig.description: Configuration values that override the container image Dockerfile settings. See Container settings.

KmsKeyArn.description: The ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that's used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If it's not provided, AWS Lambda uses a default service key.

Layers.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version.

MemorySize.description: The amount of  memory available to the function at runtime. Increasing the function memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value can be any multiple of 1 MB.

PackageType.description: The type of deployment package. Set to Image for container image and set Zip for .zip file archive.

ReservedConcurrentExecutions.description: The number of simultaneous executions to reserve for the function.

Role.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function's execution role.

Runtime.description: The identifier of the function's runtime. Runtime is required if the deployment package is a .zip file archive.

Tags.description: A list of tags to apply to the function.

Timeout.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds. For additional information, see Lambda execution environment.

TracingConfig.description: Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with X-Ray.

VpcConfig.description: For network connectivity to AWS resources in a VPC, specify a list of security groups and subnets in the VPC.

CompatibleArchitectures.description: A list of compatible instruction set architectures.

CompatibleRuntimes.description: A list of compatible function runtimes. Used for filtering with ListLayers and ListLayerVersions.

Description.description: The description of the version.

LayerName.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the layer.

LicenseInfo.description: The layer's software license. It can be any of the following:

Action.description: The API action that grants access to the layer. For example, lambda:GetLayerVersion.

LayerVersionArn.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the layer.

OrganizationId.description: With the principal set to *, grant permission to all accounts in the specified organization.

Principal.description: An account ID, or * to grant layer usage permission to all accounts in an organization, or all AWS accounts (if organizationId is not specified). For the last case, make sure that you really do want all AWS accounts to have usage permission to this layer.

Action.description: The action that the principal can use on the function. For example, lambda:InvokeFunction or lambda:GetFunction.

EventSourceToken.description: For Alexa Smart Home functions, a token that must be supplied by the invoker.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function, version, or alias.

FunctionUrlAuthType.description: The type of authentication that your function URL uses. Set to AWS_IAM if you want to restrict access to authenticated IAM users only. Set to NONE if you want to bypass IAM authentication to create a public endpoint. For more information, see  Security and auth model for Lambda function URLs.

Principal.description: The AWS service or account that invokes the function. If you specify a service, use SourceArn or SourceAccount to limit who can invoke the function through that service.

PrincipalOrgID.description: The identifier for your organization in AWS Organizations. Use this to grant permissions to all the AWS accounts under this organization.

SourceAccount.description: For Amazon S3, the ID of the account that owns the resource. Use this together with SourceArn to ensure that the resource is owned by the specified account. It is possible for an Amazon S3 bucket to be deleted by its owner and recreated by another account.

SourceArn.description: For AWS services, the ARN of the AWS resource that invokes the function. For example, an Amazon S3 bucket or Amazon SNS topic.

AuthType.description: The type of authentication that your function URL uses. Set to AWS_IAM if you want to restrict access to authenticated IAM users only. Set to NONE if you want to bypass IAM authentication to create a public endpoint. For more information, see  Security and auth model for Lambda function URLs.

Cors.description: The Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings for your function URL.

InvokeMode.description: Not currently supported by AWS CloudFormation.

TargetFunctionArn.description: The name of the Lambda function.

CodeSha256.description: Only publish a version if the hash value matches the value that's specified. Use this option to avoid publishing a version if the function code has changed since you last updated it. Updates are not supported for this property.

Description.description: A description for the version to override the description in the function configuration. Updates are not supported for this property.

FunctionName.description: The name of the Lambda function.

ProvisionedConcurrencyConfig.description: Specifies a provisioned concurrency configuration for a function's version. Updates are not supported for this property.

AutoBuildBotLocales.description: Indicates whether Amazon Lex V2 should automatically build the locales for the bot after a change.

BotFileS3Location.description: The Amazon S3 location of files used to import a bot. The files must be in the import format specified in JSON format for importing and exporting in the Amazon Lex developer guide.

BotLocales.description: A list of locales for the bot.

BotTags.description: A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

DataPrivacy.description: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

Description.description: The description of the version.

IdleSessionTTLInSeconds.description: The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

Name.description: The name of the field to filter the list of bots.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to build and run the bot.

TestBotAliasSettings.description: Specifies configuration settings for the alias used to test the bot. If the TestBotAliasSettings property is not specified, the settings are configured with default values.

TestBotAliasTags.description: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

BotAliasLocaleSettings.description: Maps configuration information to a specific locale. You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

BotAliasName.description: The name of the bot alias.

BotAliasTags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

BotId.description: The unique identifier of the bot.

BotVersion.description: The version of the bot that the bot alias references.

ConversationLogSettings.description: Specifies whether Amazon Lex logs text and audio for conversations with the bot. When you enable conversation logs, text logs store text input, transcripts of audio input, and associated metadata in Amazon CloudWatch logs. Audio logs store input in Amazon S3.

Description.description: The description of the bot alias.

SentimentAnalysisSettings.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

BotId.description: The unique identifier of the bot.

BotVersionLocaleSpecification.description: Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the Draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.

Description.description: The description of the version.

Policy.description: A resource policy to add to the resource. The policy is a JSON structure that contains one or more statements that define the policy. The policy must follow IAM syntax. If the policy isn't valid, Amazon Lex returns a validation exception.

ResourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

Principals.description: The grant principals. This value should be specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ConsumptionConfiguration.description: Configuration for consumption of the license.

Validity.description: Date and time range during which the license is valid, in ISO8601-UTC format.

ComparisonOperator.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold.

ContactProtocols.description: The contact protocols for the alarm, such as Email, SMS (text messaging), or both.

DatapointsToAlarm.description: The number of data points within the evaluation periods that must be breaching to cause the alarm to go to the ALARM state.

EvaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

MetricName.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm.

MonitoredResourceName.description: The name of the Lightsail resource that the alarm monitors.

NotificationEnabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the alarm is enabled.

NotificationTriggers.description: The alarm states that trigger a notification.

Threshold.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

TreatMissingData.description: Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.

AccessRules.description: An object that describes the access rules for the bucket.

BundleId.description: The bundle ID for the bucket (for example, small_1_0).

ObjectVersioning.description: Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.

ReadOnlyAccessAccounts.description: An array of AWS account IDs that have read-only access to the bucket.

ResourcesReceivingAccess.description: An array of Lightsail instances that have access to the bucket.

DomainName.description: The domain name of the certificate.

SubjectAlternativeNames.description: An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (such as example.org) and subdomains (such as blog.example.com) of the certificate.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

ContainerServiceDeployment.description: An object that describes the current container deployment of the container service.

IsDisabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the container service is disabled.

Power.description: The power specification of the container service.

PublicDomainNames.description: The public domain name of the container service, such as example.com and www.example.com.

Scale.description: The scale specification of the container service.

ServiceName.description: The name of the container service.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone for the database.

BackupRetention.description: A Boolean value indicating whether automated backup retention is enabled for the database.

CaCertificateIdentifier.description: The certificate associated with the database.

MasterDatabaseName.description: The meaning of this parameter differs according to the database engine you use.

MasterUserPassword.description: The password for the primary user of the database. The password can include any printable ASCII character except the following: /, ", or @. It cannot contain spaces.

MasterUsername.description: The name for the primary user.

PreferredBackupWindow.description: The daily time range during which automated backups are created for the database (for example, 16:00-16:30).

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur for the database, formatted as follows: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi. For example, Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30.

PubliclyAccessible.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the database is accessible to anyone on the internet.

RelationalDatabaseBlueprintId.description: The blueprint ID for the database (for example, mysql_8_0).

RelationalDatabaseBundleId.description: The bundle ID for the database (for example, medium_1_0).

RelationalDatabaseParameters.description: An array of parameters for the database.

RotateMasterUserPassword.description: A Boolean value indicating whether to change the primary user password to a new, strong password generated by Lightsail.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

AddOns.description: An array of add-ons for the disk.

AvailabilityZone.description: The AWS Region and Availability Zone location for the disk (for example, us-east-1a).

SizeInGb.description: The size of the disk in GB.

BundleId.description: The ID of the bundle applied to the distribution.

CacheBehaviorSettings.description: An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the distribution.

CacheBehaviors.description: An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior of the distribution.

CertificateName.description: The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution.

DefaultCacheBehavior.description: An object that describes the default cache behavior of the distribution.

IpAddressType.description: The IP address type of the distribution.

IsEnabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the distribution is enabled.

Origin.description: An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such as a Lightsail instance, bucket, or load balancer.

AddOns.description: An array of add-ons for the instance.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone for the instance.

BlueprintId.description: The blueprint ID for the instance (for example, os_amlinux_2016_03).

BundleId.description: The bundle ID for the instance (for example, micro_1_0).

Hardware.description: The hardware properties for the instance, such as the vCPU count, attached disks, and amount of RAM.

KeyPairName.description: The name of the key pair to use for the instance.

Networking.description: The public ports and the monthly amount of data transfer allocated for the instance.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

UserData.description: The optional launch script for the instance.

AttachedInstances.description: The Lightsail instances to attach to the load balancer.

HealthCheckPath.description: The path on the attached instance where the health check will be performed. If no path is specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default (root) page (/index.html).

InstancePort.description: The port that the load balancer uses to direct traffic to your Lightsail instances. For HTTP traffic, specify port 80. For HTTPS traffic, specify port 443.

IpAddressType.description: The IP address type of the load balancer.

LoadBalancerName.description: The name of the load balancer.

SessionStickinessEnabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether session stickiness is enabled.

SessionStickinessLBCookieDurationSeconds.description: The time period, in seconds, after which the load balancer session stickiness cookie should be considered stale. If you do not specify this parameter, the default value is 0, which indicates that the sticky session should last for the duration of the browser session.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

TlsPolicyName.description: The name of the TLS security policy for the load balancer.

CertificateAlternativeNames.description: An array of alternative domain names and subdomain names for your SSL/TLS certificate.

CertificateDomainName.description: The domain name for the SSL/TLS certificate. For example, example.com or www.example.com.

CertificateName.description: The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.

HttpsRedirectionEnabled.description: A Boolean value indicating whether HTTPS redirection is enabled for the load balancer that the TLS certificate is attached to.

IsAttached.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to a Lightsail load balancer.

LoadBalancerName.description: The name of the load balancer that the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to.

AttachedTo.description: The instance that the static IP is attached to.

StaticIpName.description: The name of the static IP.

CollectionName.description: A custom name for the geofence collection.

Description.description: An optional description for the geofence collection.

MapName.description: The name for the map resource.

PricingPlan.description: No longer used. If included, the only allowed value is RequestBasedUsage.

DataSource.description: Specifies the geospatial data provider for the new place index.

DataSourceConfiguration.description: Specifies the data storage option for requesting Places.

Description.description: The optional description for the place index resource.

IndexName.description: The name of the place index resource.

PricingPlan.description: No longer used. If included, the only allowed value is RequestBasedUsage.

CalculatorName.description: The name of the route calculator resource.

DataSource.description: Specifies the data provider of traffic and road network data.

PositionFiltering.description: Specifies the position filtering for the tracker resource.

TrackerName.description: The name for the tracker resource.

DestinationPolicy.description: An IAM policy document that governs which AWS accounts can create subscription filters against this destination.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of an IAM role that permits CloudWatch Logs to send data to the specified AWS resource.

TargetArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the physical target where the log events are delivered (for example, a Kinesis stream).

KmsKeyId.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS KMS key to use when encrypting log data.

LogGroupName.description: The name of the log group. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique ID for the log group.

RetentionInDays.description: The number of days to retain the log events in the specified log group. Possible values are: 1, 3, 5, 7, 14, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180, 365, 400, 545, 731, 1827, 2192, 2557, 2922, 3288, and 3653.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to the log group.

LogGroupName.description: The name of the log group where the log stream is created.

LogStreamName.description: The name of the log stream. The name must be unique within the log group.

FilterName.description: The name of the metric filter.

FilterPattern.description: A filter pattern for extracting metric data out of ingested log events. For more information, see Filter and Pattern Syntax.

LogGroupName.description: The name of an existing log group that you want to associate with this metric filter.

LogGroupNames.description: Use this parameter if you want the query to query only certain log groups.

Name.description: A name for the query definition.

QueryString.description: The query string to use for this query definition. For more information, see  CloudWatch Logs Insights Query Syntax.

PolicyDocument.description: The details of the policy. It must be formatted in JSON, and you must use backslashes to escape characters that need to be escaped in JSON strings, such as double quote marks.

PolicyName.description: The name of the resource policy.

DestinationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination.

FilterPattern.description: The filtering expressions that restrict what gets delivered to the destination AWS resource. For more information about the filter pattern syntax, see Filter and Pattern Syntax.

LogGroupName.description: The log group to associate with the subscription filter. All log events that are uploaded to this log group are filtered and delivered to the specified AWS resource if the filter pattern matches the log events.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants CloudWatch Logs permissions to deliver ingested log events to the destination stream. You don't need to provide the ARN when you are working with a logical destination for cross-account delivery.

DataDelayOffsetInMinutes.description: A period of time (in minutes) by which inference on the data is delayed after the data starts. For instance, if an offset delay time of five minutes was selected, inference will not begin on the data until the first data measurement after the five minute mark. For example, if five minutes is selected, the inference scheduler will wake up at the configured frequency with the additional five minute delay time to check the customer S3 bucket. The customer can upload data at the same frequency and they don't need to stop and restart the scheduler when uploading new data.

DataInputConfiguration.description: Specifies configuration information for the input data for the inference scheduler, including delimiter, format, and dataset location.

DataOutputConfiguration.description: Specifies configuration information for the output results for the inference scheduler, including the Amazon S3 location for the output.

DataUploadFrequency.description: How often data is uploaded to the source S3 bucket for the input data. This value is the length of time between data uploads. For instance, if you select 5 minutes, Amazon Lookout for Equipment will upload the real-time data to the source bucket once every 5 minutes. This frequency also determines how often Amazon Lookout for Equipment starts a scheduled inference on your data. In this example, it starts once every 5 minutes.

InferenceSchedulerName.description: The name of the inference scheduler.

ModelName.description: The name of the ML model used for the inference scheduler.

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a role with permission to access the data source being used for the inference.

ServerSideKmsKeyId.description: Provides the identifier of the AWS KMS key used to encrypt inference scheduler data by Amazon Lookout for Equipment.

Tags.description: Any tags associated with the inference scheduler.

Action.description: Action that will be triggered when there is an alert.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.description: An integer from 0 to 100 specifying the alert sensitivity threshold.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The ARN of the detector to which the alert is attached.

AnomalyDetectorConfig.description: Contains information about the configuration of the anomaly detector.

KmsKeyArn.description: The ARN of the KMS key to use to encrypt your data.

Definition.description: The application definition for a particular application. You can specify either inline JSON or an Amazon S3 bucket location.

Description.description: The description of the application.

EngineType.description: The type of the target platform for this application.

Name.description: The name of the application.

EngineType.description: The target platform for the runtime environment.

HighAvailabilityConfig.description: Defines the details of a high availability configuration.

InstanceType.description: The instance type of the runtime environment.

Name.description: The name of the runtime environment.

PreferredMaintenanceWindow.description: Configures the maintenance window you want for the runtime environment. If you do not provide a value, a random system-generated value will be assigned.

PubliclyAccessible.description: Specifies whether the runtime environment is publicly accessible.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The list of security groups for the VPC associated with this runtime environment.

StorageConfigurations.description: Defines the storage configuration for a runtime environment.

SubnetIds.description: The list of subnets associated with the VPC for this runtime environment.

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

ClusterArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the MSK cluster.

SecretArnList.description: A list of Amazon Secrets Manager secret ARNs.

BrokerNodeGroupInfo.description: The setup to be used for brokers in the cluster.
